  "description": "Tezza Business Solutions Limited is a leading Software Quality Assurance and Testing multinational with a regional office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a Software Quality Assurance and Testing Services provider. Our primary goal is to be the &quot;go to&quot; Quality Assurance &amp; Software Testing company in East and West Africa while developing offshore resources to fill test automation positions (and other hard to find software testing capabilities) in the North America and European markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;HR Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Responsibilities


	Provide day-to-day administrative support to the HR team.
	Assist in recruitment processes (posting vacancies, scheduling interviews, following up with candidates).
	Prepare HR documents such as employment letters, forms, and memos.
	Support onboarding by preparing orientation materials and setting up new hires.
	Maintain and update employee records and HR databases.
	Assist in tracking leave, attendance, and other HR metrics.
	Help organize training sessions, workshops, and staff engagement activities.
	Respond to basic employee queries and direct complex issues to HR Officer/Manager.
	Support payroll processing by gathering required employee information.
	Handle filing, photocopying, and other clerical HR tasks.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (or OND with relevant experience).
	1&ndash;2 years of administrative or HR-related experience preferred.
	Good knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Strong organizational and communication skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
	Detail-oriented and proactive.

HR Assistant Job at Tezza Business Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Tezza Business Solutions Limited is a leading Software Quality Assurance and Testing multinational with a regional office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a Software Quality Assurance and Testing Services provider. Our primary goal is to be the "go to" Quality Assurance & Software Testing company in East and West Africa while developing offshore resources to fill test automation positions (and other hard to find software testing capabilities) in the North America and European markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Assistant

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Provide day-to-day administrative support to the HR team.
	Assist in recruitment processes (posting vacancies, scheduling interviews, following up with candidates).
	Prepare HR documents such as employment letters, forms, and memos.
	Support onboarding by preparing orientation materials and setting up new hires.
	Maintain and update employee records and HR databases.
	Assist in tracking leave, attendance, and other HR metrics.
	Help organize training sessions, workshops, and staff engagement activities.
	Respond to basic employee queries and direct complex issues to HR Officer/Manager.
	Support payroll processing by gathering required employee information.
	Handle filing, photocopying, and other clerical HR tasks.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (or OND with relevant experience).
	1–2 years of administrative or HR-related experience preferred.
	Good knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Strong organizational and communication skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
	Detail-oriented and proactive.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Controller",
  "description": "Hartleys Supermarket and Stores is the place of choice for a wide variety of fresh meats and produce, and other quality groceries. Here at Hartleys, we are driven by a lifelong commitment to delivering healthy food selections at affordable prices in a refreshingly clean and organized shopping environment. We remain true to our tagline, &ldquo;smiles in every aisle,&rdquo; because for us, it is personal. That&rsquo;s why we go above and beyond to offer quality products and outstanding service to the people who matter most &ndash; you, our customer.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positionj: Inventory Controller
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Hartleys, one of the leading retail supermarket stores in Lagos, Nigeria is hiring an Inventory Control Specialist.
	In this role, you will be the backbone of our stock management; monitoring expiries, reducing waste, and ensuring our shelves are always well-stocked.
	You will help drive efficiency and accuracy across departments. If you are detail-oriented, proactive, and ready to make an impact, we would love to have you on board.


Key Responsibilities


	Expiry Monitoring: Track product expiry dates, implement proactive measures to reduce losses, and coordinate timely clearance of near-expiry items.
	SOR (Sale or Return): Oversee and reconcile supplier return agreements, ensuring accurate documentation and timely returns.
	Perishables Waste Control: Monitor fresh produce, dairy, and other perishables; implement wastage reduction initiatives; and maintain reports for management.
	Butchery Stock &amp; Recipes: Manage butchery formulas, recipes, and yield tracking to ensure consistency, correct pricing, and minimal shrinkage.
	Bakery Stock &amp; Recipes: Control bakery raw materials and recipes, ensuring accurate usage and reducing ingredient wastage.
	Stock Level Tracking: Continuously monitor stock levels across departments, initiate replenishment where needed, and ensure shelves are always optimally stocked.
	Error Resolution: Investigate and follow up on stock discrepancies, system errors, and supplier-related issues.
	Reporting: Provide regular reports to management on stock status, wastages, expiries, and corrective actions.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
	0&ndash;2 years of experience in finance or retail.
	Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel
	Basic understanding of financial concepts such as revenue, margins, expenses, and budgeting.
	Strong attention to detail, problem-solving ability, and eagerness to learn.
	Good communication skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights for nontechnical stakeholders.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a&nbsp;copy of their CV and cover Letter to:&nbsp;career@primera-africa.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email

Inventory Controller Job at Hartleys Supermarket and Stores




        
    

        
        Hartleys Supermarket and Stores is the place of choice for a wide variety of fresh meats and produce, and other quality groceries. Here at Hartleys, we are driven by a lifelong commitment to delivering healthy food selections at affordable prices in a refreshingly clean and organized shopping environment. We remain true to our tagline, “smiles in every aisle,” because for us, it is personal. That’s why we go above and beyond to offer quality products and outstanding service to the people who matter most – you, our customer.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positionj: Inventory Controller
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	Hartleys, one of the leading retail supermarket stores in Lagos, Nigeria is hiring an Inventory Control Specialist.
	In this role, you will be the backbone of our stock management; monitoring expiries, reducing waste, and ensuring our shelves are always well-stocked.
	You will help drive efficiency and accuracy across departments. If you are detail-oriented, proactive, and ready to make an impact, we would love to have you on board.


Key Responsibilities


	Expiry Monitoring: Track product expiry dates, implement proactive measures to reduce losses, and coordinate timely clearance of near-expiry items.
	SOR (Sale or Return): Oversee and reconcile supplier return agreements, ensuring accurate documentation and timely returns.
	Perishables Waste Control: Monitor fresh produce, dairy, and other perishables; implement wastage reduction initiatives; and maintain reports for management.
	Butchery Stock & Recipes: Manage butchery formulas, recipes, and yield tracking to ensure consistency, correct pricing, and minimal shrinkage.
	Bakery Stock & Recipes: Control bakery raw materials and recipes, ensuring accurate usage and reducing ingredient wastage.
	Stock Level Tracking: Continuously monitor stock levels across departments, initiate replenishment where needed, and ensure shelves are always optimally stocked.
	Error Resolution: Investigate and follow up on stock discrepancies, system errors, and supplier-related issues.
	Reporting: Provide regular reports to management on stock status, wastages, expiries, and corrective actions.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
	0–2 years of experience in finance or retail.
	Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel
	Basic understanding of financial concepts such as revenue, margins, expenses, and budgeting.
	Strong attention to detail, problem-solving ability, and eagerness to learn.
	Good communication skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights for nontechnical stakeholders.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV and cover Letter to: career@primera-africa.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Job Openings at Zhuli Recruiters
content:
Zhuli Recruiters, a recruitment / HR Consulting firm, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Forensic Auditor / Fraud Investigation Specialist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Fraud Investigation Specialist to take a lead role in detecting, investigating, and preventing fraud.
	This position requires extensive field engagement, collaboration with internal teams, and close interaction with law enforcement to ensure fraudulent activities are swiftly identified, contained, and resolved.


Key Responsibilities


	Investigate and gather intelligence on fraud-related activities such as tampering, identity theft, impersonation, and scams.
	Collaborate with field agents and call center teams to identify fraudulent cases and ensure timely closure.
	Work with law enforcement agencies to pursue reported fraud and tampering cases.
	Serve as a witness in legal proceedings related to fraud investigations.
	Prepare and submit regular reports on fraud-related incidents and trends.
	Train and educate staff on fraud prevention practices and its impact on the business.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree / HND in Criminal Justice, Criminology, Sociology, Psychology, Security Studies, Risk Management, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in fraud investigation, prevention, or a related field.
	Professional certification in Criminal Investigations, Fraud Management, or Business Analytics is an added advantage.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skills.
	Solid planning and organizational abilities.
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Zonal Credit Risk Manager

Job Location: Uyo, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a diligent and well-organized professional to join the Risk function as a Zonal Credit Risk Manager.
	The role involves overseeing field collections, assessing risks, identifying fraud, and ensuring credit processes align with customer expectations.
	You will play a key role in improving payment performance, enhancing customer satisfaction, and strengthening risk management practices.


Key Responsibilities


	Support the Credit Manager in developing and enhancing credit processes and methodologies.
	Recommend process and policy improvements to reduce operational risks.
	Prepare reports and presentations, outlining findings and making recommendations.
	Assist in implementing audit recommendations and conducting follow-up checks.
	Conduct periodic spot checks on processes, identifying risks and suggesting corrective measures.
	Investigate fraud cases, including data gathering and claimant interviews, and recommend resolutions.
	Identify and classify potential default risks through data analysis and client interactions.
	Prepare and submit field reports, ensuring accurate data collation and documentation.
	Flag potential risks early and ensure timely escalation.


Candidate Profile


	Minimum of 4 years of experience in Credit Control, Compliance, or Risk Management.
	Strong data collection and analysis skills.
	Proven experience in fraud detection and investigation.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Advanced level).
	Strong problem-solving abilities.
	Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
	Previous experience in microfinance institutions or banks preferred.
	Multilingual skills (English & Igbo/Ibibio/Efik/Hausa) are an advantage.
	Familiarity with the territory is desirable.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

 

 

3.) Inventory & Store Executive

Job Locations: Ekiti, Enugu, Sokoto, Zamfara, Wukari - Taraba, Bida - Niger, Kogi, and Abakaliki - Ebonyi
Employment Type: Full-time
Work days: Monday - Saturday
Resumption Time: 8am - 5pm (Week days), 9am- 12pm(Saturday)

Key Responsibilities


	Inventory Management: Receive, issue, and record stock using FIFO; conduct daily counts and audits; manage faulty items and spare parts.
	Reporting: Prepare daily stock reports; track inventory movements for restocking or replacements.
	Repairs & Tools: Perform basic diagnostics and minor repairs; manage tools and warranty checks.
	Store & Customer Support: Keep store clean and safe; assist walk-in customers and support field agents.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
	3+ years of experience in inventory, logistics, store-Keeping, or retail
	Proficient in Excel and Word
	Strong communication skills, integrity, and customer focus
	Familiarity with Wukari or Bida as a location


Application Closing Date: 29th October, 2025.

Click here to apply online
